circumstances: Shortly after a night takeoff from Culpeper Airport, while in initial climb, the twin engine airplane baked right then lost height, struck trees and crashed in a wooded area, bursting into flames. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Powerplant failure during initial climb for undetermined reasons. The following findings were reported:
- High obstructions, 
- Still dark at the time of the accident, 
- Right engine found shut down and its propeller feathered at impact.
